original_content:
05/02/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~Kindness is power, even when fondness is not.

Our Bible Verse for Today:

But we have this treasure in jars of clay to show that this
all-surpassing power is from God and not from us...
(2 Cor. 4:7) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The valuable treasure we have is the message of salvation
in Jesus Christ, which has been entrusted by God to us frail
human beings (jars of clay)...

We see that Paul's focus, was not on the perishable container 
but on its priceless contents ~ God's power dwelling in us...

Though we are weak, God uses us to spread His Good News,
and He gives us power to do His work. Knowing the power is His, 
not ours, should keep us from pride and motivate us to keep
daily contact with God, our power source...

Our responsibility is to let people see God through us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for another day of grace,
I pray that today I would be sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's 
leading. I pray that my actions today would reflect my love
for You in such a way that others would be drawn to You,
I pray for that power Amen...

Keep looking up, and He will give you the power...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: The valuable treasure we have is the message of salvation in Jesus Christ, which has been entrusted by God to us frail human beings (jars of clay). We see that Paul's focus, was not on the perishable container but on its priceless contents ~ God's power dwelling in us. Though we are weak, God uses us to spread His Good News, and He gives us power to do His work. Knowing the power is His, not ours, should keep us from pride and motivate us to keep daily contact with God, our power source. Our responsibility is to let people see God through us.
original_verse_text: But we have this treasure in jars of clay to show that this all-surpassing power is from God and not from us.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You as Your humble vessels, jars of clay entrusted with the priceless treasure of Your salvation in Christ. Though we are weak and frail, we are in awe of Your power that dwells within us. Grant us the strength and wisdom to let Your light shine through our lives, that others may see You and be drawn to Your good news. Keep us ever mindful that the power is Yours, not our own, that we may walk in humility and constant communion with You, our source of strength. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The valuable treasure we have is the message of salvation in Jesus Christ, which has been entrusted by God to us frail human beings (jars of clay). We see that Paul's focus was not on the perishable container but on its priceless contentsâ€”God's power dwelling in us. Though we are weak, God uses us to spread His Good News, and He gives us power to do His work. Knowing the power is His, not ours, should keep us from pride and motivate us to keep daily contact with God, our power source. Our responsibility is to let people see God through us.
subject: Treasure in Jars of Clay: God's Power In
verse_text: But we have this treasure in jars of clay to show that this all-surpassing power is from God and not from us.

original_content:
05/03/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~All learning has an emotional base...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

We are hard pressed on every side, but not crushed; perplexed,
but not in despair; 

Persecuted, but not abandoned; struck down, but not destroyed.

We always carry around in our body the death of Jesus, so that 
the life of Jesus may always be revealed in our body...

For we who are alive are always being given over to death for
Jesus sake, so that His life may be revealed in our mortal body.

So then, death is at work in us, but life is at work in You...(2 Cor 4:8-12) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul reminds us that though we may feel we are at the end of our rope,
we are never at the end of hope...

Our perishable body is subject to sin and suffering, but God never abandons
us. Because Christ has won the victory over death, we have eternal life...

All our risks, humiliation, and trails are opportunities for Christ to demonstrate
His power and presence in and through us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I often have felt as though I was at the
end of my rope, but as I recall Ps. 50:15 I am strengthened again,
for as You say in that text, "Call upon Me in the day of trouble; I
will deliver you, and you will honor me." So today once again I
give You thanks, for You are a Great and Awesome God...Amen

Keep looking up, for He is indeed a Great and Awesome God...
Your are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sathe
original_reflection_text: Paul reminds us that though we may feel we are at the end of our rope, we are never at the end of hope. Our perishable body is subject to sin and suffering, but God never abandons us. Because Christ has won the victory over death, we have eternal life. All our risks, humiliation, and trails are opportunities for Christ to demonstrate His power and presence in and through us.
original_verse_text: We are hard pressed on every side, but not crushed; perplexed, but not in despair; Persecuted, but not abandoned; struck down, but not destroyed. We always carry around in our body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may always be revealed in our body. For we who are alive are always being given over to death for Jesus sake, so that His life may be revealed in our mortal body. So then, death is at work in us, but life is at work in You.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You in humble gratitude, knowing that even in our darkest moments, Your love and grace never fail. Though we may face trials and tribulations, we cling to the truth that nothing can separate us from Your love in Christ Jesus our Lord. Grant us the strength to endure, the faith to trust in Your plan, and the courage to be vessels of Your power, that we may bring glory to Your name. In the midst of our struggles, may we find comfort in the assurance that You are with us, sustaining us through every circumstance. We praise You, our Almighty God, for Your unwavering faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: Paul reminds us that though we may feel we are at the end of our rope, we are never at the end of hope. Our perishable body is subject to sin and suffering, but God never abandons us. Because Christ has won the victory over death, we have eternal life. All our risks, humiliation, and trials are opportunities for Christ to demonstrate His power and presence in and through us.
subject: Eternal Hope in Christ's Victory
verse_text: We are hard pressed on every side, but not crushed; perplexed, but not in despair; Persecuted, but not abandoned; struck down, but not destroyed. We always carry around in our body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may always be revealed in our body. For we who are alive are always being given over to death for Jesus sake, so that His life may be revealed in our mortal body. So then, death is at work in us, but life is at work in You.

original_content:
05/05/08 ~~~(food for thought)~~~ Don't wait for people to be kind, show them how...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Therefore do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, 
yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day...(2 Cor. 4:16) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Sometimes it is very easy to lose heart and quit...

We have all had problems in our relationships or in our work that
have caused us to think about giving up. BUT rather than quitting 
when persecution wore him down, Paul concentrated on the inner 
strength that came from the Holy Spirit (Eph. 3:16)...

Don't let fatigue, pain or criticism force you off the job. renew your
commitment to serving Christ. Don't forsake your eternal reward
because of the intensity of today's pain...

Your very weakness allows the resurrection power of Christ to strengthen
you moment by moment...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for throwing up my hands
and giving into the trials of the day. Help me to remember
that in You there is an abundance of strength for those who
will call upon You...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will carry you through...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Sometimes it is very easy to lose heart and quit. We have all had problems in our relationships or in our work that have caused us to think about giving up. BUT rather than quitting when persecution wore him down, Paul concentrated on the inner strength that came from the Holy Spirit (Ephesians 3:16). Don't let fatigue, pain or criticism force you off the job. renew your commitment to serving Christ. Don't forsake your eternal reward because of the intensity of today's pain. Your very weakness allows the resurrection power of Christ to strengthen you moment by moment.
original_verse_text: Therefore do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, weary and worn from the trials of this world. Yet, we are reminded of Your promise in 2 Corinthians 4:16 that though our outer self is wasting away, our inner self is being renewed day by day. Lord, we pray that by the power of Your Holy Spirit, as described in Ephesians 3, You would strengthen us from within, that Christ may dwell in our hearts through faith. Grant us the courage to persevere, even when the pain and criticism seem overwhelming. May Your resurrection power sustain us, moment by moment, as we seek to serve You faithfully. Amen.
reflection: Sometimes it is very easy to lose heart and quit. We have all had problems in our relationships or in our work that have caused us to think about giving up. But rather than quitting when persecution wore him down, Paul concentrated on the inner strength that came from the Holy Spirit (Ephesians 3:16). Don't let fatigue, pain, or criticism force you off the job. Renew your commitment to serving Christ. Don't forsake your eternal reward because of the intensity of today's pain. Your very weakness allows the resurrection power of Christ to strengthen you moment by moment.
subject: Renew Your Commitment to Serve Christ
verse_text: Therefore do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day.

original_content:
05/06/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Unlike socks, may our faith and actions always match...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us 
an eternal glory the outweighs them all... (2 Cor. 4:17) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Our troubles should not diminish our faith or disillusions us. We should 
realize that there is a purpose for our suffering. Problems and human
limitations have several benefits.
(1) They should remind us of Christ's suffering for us;
(2) They should keep us from pride;
(3) They should cause us to look beyond this brief life;
(4) They should give us opportunities to prove our faith to others; and
(5) They should give God the opportunity to demonstrate His power...

Let us remember to see our troubles as opportunities...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for added faith and trust in You.
Help me to see what You are trying to teach me in times of
trouble. Forgive me for the lack of faith...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is waiting for your beckon call...
You are in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Our troubles should not diminish our faith or disillusions us. We should realize that there is a purpose for our suffering. Problems and human limitations have several benefits. (1) They should remind us of Christ's suffering for us; (2) They should keep us from pride; (3) They should cause us to look beyond this brief life; (4) They should give us opportunities to prove our faith to others; and (5) They should give God the opportunity to demonstrate His power. Let us remember to see our troubles as opportunities.
original_verse_text: For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory the outweighs them all.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our troubles, though difficult, serve a greater purpose in Your divine plan. Help us to see beyond the momentary afflictions and fix our eyes on the eternal glory that awaits us. May our sufferings draw us closer to the example of Christ's sacrifice and keep us humble, ever-dependent on Your strength. Use our trials as opportunities to demonstrate Your power and faithfulness, that we may testify to Your goodness and bring glory to Your name. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Our troubles should not diminish our faith or disillusion us. We should realize that there is a purpose for our suffering. Problems and human limitations have several benefits: (1) They should remind us of Christ's suffering for us; (2) They should keep us from pride; (3) They should cause us to look beyond this brief life; (4) They should give us opportunities to prove our faith to others; and (5) They should give God the opportunity to demonstrate His power. Let us remember to see our troubles as opportunities.
subject: The Blessings of Our Troubles
verse_text: For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory the outweighs them all.

original_content:
05/06/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Let the wise listen and add to their learning (Pro. 1:3)...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

So we fix our eyes not on what is seen, but what is unseen.
For what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal.
(2 Cor 4:18)...

Our Lesson for Today:

Our ultimate hope when we are experiencing a terrible illness, 
persecution, or pain is the realization that this life is not all there
is ~

Let us remember there is life after death! Having the assurance
that we will live forever with God in a place without sin and suffering 
can help us live above the pain we face in this life...

Let us pray that we will be joined by all our family members in that place...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord Jesus I thank You for the promise of a better life
after death ~ a place prepared by You ~ a place where there 
will be no more sin and pain ~ where we will live with You forever...Amen.

Keep looking up, He promises to give us peace...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...
original_reflection_text: Our ultimate hope when we are experiencing a terrible illness, persecution, or pain is the realization that this life is not all there is ~ Let us remember there is life after death! Having the assurance that we will live forever with God in a place without sin and suffering can help us live above the pain we face in this life. Let us pray that we will be joined by all our family members in that place.
original_verse_text: So we fix our eyes not on what is seen, but what is unseen. For what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the promise of eternal life with You in a place free from sin and suffering. Help us to keep our eyes fixed on the unseen and eternal, not the temporary and visible. May the assurance of Your eternal kingdom give us strength and hope as we face the trials and tribulations of this life. We pray that all our loved ones would come to know You and join us in Your glorious presence. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Our ultimate hope when we are experiencing a terrible illness, persecution, or pain is the realization that this life is not all there is. Let us remember there is life after death! Having the assurance that we will live forever with God in a place without sin and suffering can help us live above the pain we face in this life. Let us pray that we will be joined by all our family members in that place.
subject: Eternal Life Awaits Beyond This World
verse_text: So we fix our eyes not on what is seen, but what is unseen. For what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal.

original_content:
05/08/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Before beginning ~ prepare carefully

Our Bible Verses for Today:

While we are in this tent (body) we groan and are burdened, 
because we do not wish to be unclothed but to be clothed 
with our heavenly dwelling, so that what is mortal may be 
swallowed up by life...

Now it is God who has made us for this very purpose and has
given us the Spirit as a deposit, guaranteeing what is to come.
(2 Cor. 5:4, 5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Holy Spirit within us is our guarantee that God will give us
an everlasting body at the resurrection (2 Cor. 1:22). We have 
eternity in us now!!!

This truth should give us great courage and patience to endure 
anything we might have to experience...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the promise that 
one day I will receive an everlasting body. A body that
will not experience tears or sorrows, pain or suffering.
I pray this in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, true wisdom comes from Him...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...
original_reflection_text: The Holy Spirit within us is our guarantee that God will give us an everlasting body at the resurrection (2 Corinthians 1:22). We have eternity in us now!!! This truth should give us great courage and patience to endure anything we might have to experience.
original_verse_text: While we are in this tent (body) we groan and are burdened, because we do not wish to be unclothed but to be clothed with our heavenly dwelling, so that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life. Now it is God who has made us for this very purpose and has given us the Spirit as a deposit, guaranteeing what is to come.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of Your Holy Spirit, which dwells within us and is the guarantee of our eternal inheritance (Ephesians 1:13, 14). May this truth fill our hearts with unwavering hope, even as we groan inwardly, longing for the day when we will be clothed with our heavenly dwelling (2 Corinthians 5:4, 5). Grant us the courage and patience to endure all things, knowing that our eternal home awaits. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The Holy Spirit within us is our guarantee that God will give us an everlasting body at the resurrection (2 Corinthians 1:22). We have eternity in us now. This truth should give us great courage and patience to endure anything we might have to experience.
subject: Eternal Life Guaranteed by the Spirit
verse_text: While we are in this tent (body) we groan and are burdened, because we do not wish to be unclothed but to be clothed with our heavenly dwelling, so that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life. Now it is God who has made us for this very purpose and has given us the Spirit as a deposit, guaranteeing what is to come.

original_content:
05/10/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ 99% of failures come from people who 
have a habit of making excuses...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

You see, at just the right time. when we were still powerless,
Christ died for the ungodly...

Very rarely will anyone die for a righteous man, though for a 
good man someone might possibly dare to die...

But God demonstrates His own love for us in this: While we 
were still sinners, Christ died for us... (2 Cor. 5:6-8) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul was not afraid to die because He was confident of spending 
eternity with Christ...

Of course facing the unknown may cause us anxiety, and leaving 
loved ones hurts deeply, but if we believe in Jesus Christ, we can 
share Paul's hope and confidence of eternal life with Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the guarantee all born-again
believers have in Christ Jesus. I pray that a revival would rise up in 
this country, so that we would receive further blessings from You.
Oh that this country would experience true peace again. I pray that 
the survivors of the hurricane would receive clean water and food
before more people die. I pray for a miracle...Amen.

Keep looking up, God still does miracles...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Paul was not afraid to die because He was confident of spending eternity with Christ. Of course facing the unknown may cause us anxiety, and leaving loved ones hurts deeply, but if we believe in Jesus Christ, we can share Paul's hope and confidence of eternal life with Christ.
original_verse_text: You see, at just the right time. when we were still powerless, Christ died for the ungodly. Very rarely will anyone die for a righteous man, though for a good man someone might possibly dare to die. But God demonstrates His own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that nothing can separate us from Your love in Christ Jesus our Lord. Though the unknown may bring us fear, we cling to the promise that neither death nor life, nor anything else in all creation, can ever divide us from Your eternal embrace. Grant us the faith to walk by trust, not by sight, as we await the day when we will be forever with You. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: Paul was not afraid to die because he was confident of spending eternity with Christ. Of course, facing the unknown may cause us anxiety, and leaving loved ones hurts deeply, but if we believe in Jesus Christ, we can share Paul's hope and confidence of eternal life with Christ.
subject: Confident in Christ's Eternal Presence
verse_text: You see, at just the right time. when we were still powerless, Christ died for the ungodly. Very rarely will anyone die for a righteous man, though for a good man someone might possibly dare to die. But God demonstrates His own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.

original_content:
05/12/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Let not the sun go down upon your wrath...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

So we make it our goal to please Him, whether 
we are at home in the body or away from it...

For we must all appear before the judgement seat
of Christ, that each one may receive what is due
him for the things done while in the body, whether
good or bad...(2 Cor 5:9, 10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

While eternal live is a gift given on the basis of God's grace 
(Eph. 2:8, 9), each of us will still be judged by Christ. He will 
reward us for how we have lived...

God's gracious gift of salvation does not free us from the 
requirement of faithful obedience. All Christians must give
an account on the day of judgment of how they have lived ~
Mt. 16:27 ~ Ro. 14:10-12 ~ I Cor. 3:10-15...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for another day ~ a day of grace,
but help me to always remember that with Your love, You are also a 
holy and just God. Forgive me Lord for I have sinned against You in 
thought word and deed. I pray for a sensitivity to Your Holy Spirit's 
leading and guiding. I pray these things in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, allow Him to walk with you today...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: While eternal live is a gift given on the basis of God's grace (Ephesians 2:8, 9), each of us will still be judged by Christ. He will reward us for how we have lived. God's gracious gift of salvation does not free us from the requirement of faithful obedience. All Christians must give an account on the day of judgment of how they have lived ~ Matthew 16:27 ~ Romans 14:10-12 ~ I Corinthians 3:10-15.
original_verse_text: So we make it our goal to please Him, whether we are at home in the body or away from it. For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, that each one may receive what is due him for the things done while in the body, whether good or bad.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that we are Your workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works (Ephesians 2:10). Help us to live in a manner that is pleasing to You, striving to honor You in all that we do, knowing that we will one day stand before the judgment seat of Christ (2 Corinthians 5:9-10). May our lives be a reflection of Your grace and a testimony to Your faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: While eternal life is a gift given on the basis of God's grace (Ephesians 2:8, 9), each of us will still be judged by Christ. He will reward us for how we have lived. God's gracious gift of salvation does not free us from the requirement of faithful obedience. All Christians must give an account on the day of judgment of how they have lived ~ Matthew 16:27 ~ Romans 14:10-12 ~ 1 Corinthians 3:10-15.
subject: Faithful Obedience Leads to Eternal Rewards
verse_text: So we make it our goal to please Him, whether we are at home in the body or away from it. For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, that each one may receive what is due him for the things done while in the body, whether good or bad.

original_content:
05/13/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Even if we can't be happy, we must always be cheerful...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Since, then, we know what it is to fear the Lord, we try to persuade
men. What we are is plain to God, and I hope it is also plain to your
conscience...

We are not trying to commend ourselves to you again, but are giving 
you an opportunity to take pride in us, so that you can answer those 
who take pride in what is seen rather than in what is in the heart...
(2 Cor. 5:11-12) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

What Paul is attempting to say is:

Those who "brag about having a spectacular ministry rather than 
having a sincere heart before God" are the false preachers 
(2 Cor. 2:17).

They are the preachers who were, and are, concerned only about 
getting ahead in this world. They were, and are, preaching the Good 
News for money and popularity...

Paul and his companions were preaching out of concern for eternity.
We can identify false preachers by finding out what really motivates
them...

If they are more concerned about themselves than about Christ,
avoid them and their message...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to remain more concerned about
the truth being shared with others than I am about my own needs.
Let me not be a stumbling block to my brothers and sisters in the 
Lord...Amen.

Keep looking up, and you will know the truth 
and the truth will set you free...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: What Paul is attempting to say is: Those who "brag about having a spectacular ministry rather than having a sincere heart before God" are the false preachers (2 Corinthians 2:17). They are the preachers who were, and are, concerned only about getting ahead in this world. They were, and are, preaching the Good News for money and popularity. Paul and his companions were preaching out of concern for eternity. We can identify false preachers by finding out what really motivates them. If they are more concerned about themselves than about Christ, avoid them and their message.
original_verse_text: Since, then, we know what it is to fear the Lord, we try to persuade men. What we are is plain to God, and I hope it is also plain to your conscience. We are not trying to commend ourselves to you again, but are giving you an opportunity to take pride in us, so that you can answer those who take pride in what is seen rather than in what is in the heart.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to walk worthy of the calling to which we have been called (Ephesians 4:1). Help us to be diligent in preserving the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace (Ephesians 4:3), not seeking our own glory, but rather the glory of Your Son, Jesus Christ. May we be motivated by a sincere love for You and a deep concern for the eternal well-being of others, rather than the pursuit of worldly gain. Guide us, Lord, that we may discern the true shepherds from the false, and follow only those who proclaim Your truth with unwavering devotion. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: What Paul is attempting to say is: Those who "brag about having a spectacular ministry rather than having a sincere heart before God" are the false preachers (2 Corinthians 2:17). They are the preachers who were, and are, concerned only about getting ahead in this world. They were, and are, preaching the Good News for money and popularity. Paul and his companions were preaching out of concern for eternity. We can identify false preachers by finding out what really motivates them. If they are more concerned about themselves than about Christ, avoid them and their message.
subject: Beware False Preachers Motivated by Self
verse_text: Since, then, we know what it is to fear the Lord, we try to persuade men. What we are is plain to God, and I hope it is also plain to your conscience. We are not trying to commend ourselves to you again, but are giving you an opportunity to take pride in us, so that you can answer those who take pride in what is seen rather than in what is in the heart.

original_content:
05/14/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ If you are patient in one moment of anger,
you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says, "If we are out of our mind, it is for the sake of God;
If we are in our right mind, it is for you...

For Christ's love compels us, because we are convinced that
one died for all, and therefore all died...

And He died for all, that those who live should no longer live
for themselves but for Him who died for them and was raised
again...(2 Cor. 5:13-15) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Everything that Paul and his companions did was to honor God.
Christ's love controlled their lives...

Because Christ died for us, we also are dead to our old life.
Like Paul we should no longer live to please ourselves, we
should spend our lives pleasing Christ, who died for us and
rose again from the grave...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would forgive me for
I have not honored You as I should have. Help me to live a 
more pleasing life for You...Amen.

Keep looking up, for this is pleasing to Him...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Everything that Paul and his companions did was to honor God. Christ's love controlled their lives. Because Christ died for us, we also are dead to our old life. Like Paul we should no longer live to please ourselves, we should spend our lives pleasing Christ, who died for us and rose again from the grave.
original_verse_text: Paul says, "If we are out of our mind, it is for the sake of God; If we are in our right mind, it is for you. For Christ's love compels us, because we are convinced that one died for all, and therefore all died. And He died for all, that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for Him who died for them and was raised again.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we do should be to honor and glorify Your name. May the love of Christ control our lives, as it did for the Apostle Paul, that we may no longer live for ourselves but for the One who died and rose again for our sake. Help us to present our bodies as living sacrifices, holy and acceptable to You, and to be transformed by the renewing of our minds, that we may discern Your good, pleasing, and perfect will. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Everything that Paul and his companions did was to honor God. Christ's love controlled their lives. Because Christ died for us, we also are dead to our old life. Like Paul, we should no longer live to please ourselves; we should spend our lives pleasing Christ, who died for us and rose again from the grave.
subject: Honoring God Through Christ's Love
verse_text: Paul says, "If we are out of our mind, it is for the sake of God; If we are in our right mind, it is for you. For Christ's love compels us, because we are convinced that one died for all, and therefore all died. And He died for all, that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for Him who died for them and was raised again.

original_content:
05/14/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Don't ask what can He do for me ~ 
Ask what does He want me to do for Him...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Therefore if any one is in Christ, he is a new creation;
the old has gone, the new has come...(2 Cor. 5:17) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When one accepts Christ as their Savior they become new people on the inside.
The Holy Spirit gives them a new life, and they are not the same anymore...

We are not reformed, rehabilitated, or reeducated ~ we are re-created
(new creations), living in vital union with Christ (Col. 2:6, 7).

At conversion we do not merely turn over a new leaf, we began a new life
under a new Master...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for making it possible for me to 
have a new life ~ a life serving You each day. Help me Lord to
continue in a living relationship with You...Amen.

Keep looking up, let His light shine through you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: When one accepts Christ as their Savior they become new people on the inside. The Holy Spirit gives them a new life, and they are not the same anymore. We are not reformed, rehabilitated, or reeducated ~ we are recreated (new creations), living in vital union with Christ (Colossians 2:6, 7). At conversion we do not merely turn over a new leaf, we began a new life under a new Master.
original_verse_text: Therefore if any one is in Christ, he is a new creation; the old has gone, the new has come.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for in Your great love, You have made us new creations in Christ. Through our baptism, we have been buried with Him and raised to walk in newness of life. May we live out this reality, no longer slaves to sin but servants of righteousness, empowered by Your Holy Spirit to live for Your glory. Transform us daily, Lord, that we may grow in our vital union with Christ, our Savior and Lord. Amen.
reflection: When one accepts Christ as their Savior, they become new people on the inside. The Holy Spirit gives them a new life, and they are not the same anymore. We are not reformed, rehabilitated, or reeducated; we are recreated (new creations), living in vital union with Christ (Colossians 2:6, 7). At conversion, we do not merely turn over a new leaf; we began a new life under a new Master.
subject: Becoming New Creations in Christ
verse_text: Therefore if any one is in Christ, he is a new creation; the old has gone, the new has come.

original_content:
05/16/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ One of the best ways to persuade others, 
is with your ears...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

All this is from God who reconciled us to Himself through Christ
and gave us the ministry of reconciliation:

that God was reconciling the world to Himself in Christ, not counting 
men's sins against them. And He has committed to us the message 
of reconciliation...(2 Cor. 5:18, 19) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

God brings us back to Himself (reconcile us) by blotting out our sins.
(see also Eph. 2:13-18) and making us right with Him...

When we trust in Christ, we are no longer God's enemies, or strangers 
or foreigners to Him. Because we have been reconciled to God, we 
have the privilege of encouraging others to do the same...

Yes we too have the task of reconciling people to Him...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the promise that my sins
are blotted out as soon as I confess them. Help me to grow day 
by day in faith and holiness...Amen.

Keep looking up, trusting in Him for your every need...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: God brings us back to Himself (reconcile us) by blotting out our sins. (see also Ephesians 2:13-18) and making us right with Him. When we trust in Christ, we are no longer God's enemies, or strangers or foreigners to Him. Because we have been reconciled to God, we have the privilege of encouraging others to do the same. Yes we too have the task of reconciling people to Him.
original_verse_text: All this is from God who reconciled us to Himself through Christ and gave us the ministry of reconciliation: that God was reconciling the world to Himself in Christ, not counting men's sins against them. And He has committed to us the message of reconciliation.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the gift of reconciliation through Your Son, Jesus Christ. Though we were once Your enemies, You have graciously brought us back to Yourself, forgiving our sins and making us right in Your sight. Fill us with the same spirit of reconciliation, that we may encourage others to be reconciled to You, the source of all peace and life. May we faithfully carry out this sacred task, for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: God brings us back to Himself (reconcile us) by blotting out our sins (see also Ephesians 2:13-18) and making us right with Him. When we trust in Christ, we are no longer God's enemies or strangers or foreigners to Him. Because we have been reconciled to God, we have the privilege of encouraging others to do the same. Yes, we too have the task of reconciling people to Him.
subject: Reconciled to God: Restored, Renewed, Redeemed
verse_text: All this is from God who reconciled us to Himself through Christ and gave us the ministry of reconciliation: that God was reconciling the world to Himself in Christ, not counting men's sins against them. And He has committed to us the message of reconciliation.

original_content:
05/17/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ You can't take your money with you,
but you can send it on ahead...(Mt.6:19, 20)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

We are therefore Christ's ambassadors, as though
God were making His appeal through us. We implore
you on Christ's behalf; Be reconciled to God...(2 Cor 5:20) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

An ambassador is an official representative of one country to another.

As believers, we are Christ's ambassadors, sent with His message
of reconciliation to the world...

An ambassador of reconciliation has an important responsibility. We 
dare not take this responsibility lightly. How well are you fulfilling
your commission as Christ's ambassador...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would forgive me of my sins
of thought word and deed ~ my sins of omission and commission.
Help me to fill my responsibility as You ambassador...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will guide you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: An ambassador is an official representative of one country to another. As believers, we are Christ's ambassadors, sent with His message of reconciliation to the world. An ambassador of reconciliation has an important responsibility. We dare not take this responsibility lightly. How well are you fulfilling your commission as Christ's ambassador.
original_verse_text: We are therefore Christ's ambassadors, as though God were making His appeal through us. We implore you on Christ's behalf; Be reconciled to God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You as Your humble ambassadors, called to proclaim the message of reconciliation to a world in need. Forgive us for the times when we have failed to represent You faithfully, and empower us by Your Spirit to be bold and effective in our witness. May our lives reflect the transforming power of the gospel, that many may be drawn to the hope and peace found in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Use us as instruments of Your love and grace, that the world may know the joy of being reconciled to You. Amen.
reflection: An ambassador is an official representative of one country to another. As believers, we are Christ's ambassadors, sent with His message of reconciliation to the world. An ambassador of reconciliation has an important responsibility. We dare not take this responsibility lightly. How well are you fulfilling your commission as Christ's ambassador.
subject: Ambassadors of Christ's Reconciliation
verse_text: We are therefore Christ's ambassadors, as though God were making His appeal through us. We implore you on Christ's behalf; Be reconciled to God.

original_content:
05/19/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~Your words are windows to your heart. (Mt. 12:34b)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

God made Him who had no sin to be sin for us,
so that in Him we might become the righteousness
of God. (2 Cor. 5:21) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When we trust in Christ, we make an exchange: He takes
our sin and makes us right with God. Our sin was laid on
Christ at His crucifixion...

His righteousness is given to us at our conversion. This is 
what is meant by Christ's atonement for sin. In the world
bartering works only when two people exchange goods of 
similar value...

BUT God offers to trade his righteousness for our sin something
of immeasurable worth, for something completely worthless...

OH how grateful we should be for His kindness to us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, I do thank you for Your immeasurable love
that You were willing to make an atonement for my sin through the
blood of Christ. I pray for Your Holy Spirit's leading and guiding.
Help me to walk in a closer walk with thee...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will light your path...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: When we trust in Christ, we make an exchange: He takes our sin and makes us right with God. Our sin was laid on Christ at His crucifixion. His righteousness is given to us at our conversion. This is what is meant by Christ's atonement for sin. In the world bartering works only when two people exchange goods of similar value. BUT God offers to trade his righteousness for our sin something of immeasurable worth, for something completely worthless. OH how grateful we should be for His kindness to us.
original_verse_text: God made Him who had no sin to be sin for us, so that in Him we might become the righteousness of God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, overwhelmed by Your unfathomable love and grace. You have graciously made us right with You, taking our sin and bestowing upon us the righteousness of Your Son, Jesus Christ. We are undeserving, yet You have lavished us with the riches of Your mercy and the gift of eternal life. May our lives reflect the gratitude we feel for this wondrous exchange, that we may honor You in all we do. In the name of our Savior, Jesus, we pray. Amen.
reflection: When we trust in Christ, we make an exchange: He takes our sin and makes us right with God. Our sin was laid on Christ at His crucifixion. His righteousness is given to us at our conversion. This is what is meant by Christ's atonement for sin. In the world, bartering works only when two people exchange goods of similar value. But God offers to trade His righteousness for our sin, something of immeasurable worth, for something completely worthless. Oh, how grateful we should be for His kindness to us.
subject: The Incredible Exchange of Christ's Atonement
verse_text: God made Him who had no sin to be sin for us, so that in Him we might become the righteousness of God.

original_content:
05/20/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ A shut mouth gathers no foot...(Pro. 13:3)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

As God's fellow workers we urge you not to receive God's
grace in vain...(2 Cor. 6:1) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

How could the Corinthian believers reject God's message?
Was it that they were doubting Paul and his words, confused
by the false teachers, who taught a different message?

The people heard God's message but did not let it affect what 
they said and did...

How often do you reject God's message?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would be sensitive and
receptive to Your message. I pray for a teachable heart and 
spirit. Bless each of my e-mail friends with safety and good 
health Amen...

Keep looking up, with an attitude of faith...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: How could the Corinthian believers reject God's message? Was it that they were doubting Paul and his words, confused by the false teachers, who taught a different message? The people heard God's message but did not let it affect what they said and did. How often do you reject God's message?
original_verse_text: As God's fellow workers we urge you not to receive God's grace in vain.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by the reality that we so often reject Your message and fail to let it transform our lives. Help us to heed the warnings in Your Word, lest we drift away from the truth. Grant us the wisdom and discernment to recognize the deception of false teachers, and the courage to stand firm in our faith. May we not merely hear Your voice, but respond with obedience and a deep commitment to live according to Your will. Lord, we ask that You would strengthen our grip on the salvation You have graciously provided. Amen.
reflection: How could the Corinthian believers reject God's message? Was it that they were doubting Paul and his words, confused by the false teachers who taught a different message? The people heard God's message but did not let it affect what they said and did. How often do you reject God's message?
subject: Rejecting God's Message: a Cautionary Tale
verse_text: As God's fellow workers we urge you not to receive God's grace in vain.

original_content:
05/21/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ A drowning man does not complain about 
the size of a life preserver. (Phil. 2:14)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

For He says, "In the time of My favor I heard you. and in the day
of salvation I helped you." I tell you, now is the time of God's favor,
now is the day of salvation...(2 Cor. 6:2)

Our Lesson for Today:

God offers salvation to all people. Many people put off a decision for
Christ, thinking there will be a better time ~ BUT they could miss their 
opportunity all together...

There is no time like the present to receive God's forgiveness. Don't
let anything hold you back from coming to Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You again for the assurance 
of salvation. I pray Lord for a revival once again in this country. 
I pray for the safety of this nation and our troops. I pray for wisdom
for our countries leaders both federal, state, and local, give wisdom
to our military leaders too...Amen.

Keep looking up, keep our nation in prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: God offers salvation to all people. Many people put off a decision for Christ, thinking there will be a better time ~ BUT they could miss their opportunity all together. There is no time like the present to receive God's forgiveness. Don't let anything hold you back from coming to Christ.
original_verse_text: For He says, "In the time of My favor I heard you. and in the day of salvation I helped you." I tell you, now is the time of God's favor, now is the day of salvation.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of salvation that You freely offer to all who would come to You. Help us to heed the urgency of Your call, not delaying our response to Your gracious invitation. May we not miss the opportune time, but instead embrace Your mercy and forgiveness today. Empower us by Your Spirit to walk in newness of life, for in You we find abundant life. Amen.
reflection: God offers salvation to all people. Many people put off a decision for Christ, thinking there will be a better time, but they could miss their opportunity altogether. There is no time like the present to receive God's forgiveness. Don't let anything hold you back from coming to Christ.
subject: Receive God's Forgiveness Today
verse_text: For He says, "In the time of My favor I heard you. and in the day of salvation I helped you." I tell you, now is the time of God's favor, now is the day of salvation.

original_content:
05/22/08 ~~~~~~ I will be out of town Fri. & Sat so there won't be any devotion.

Our Bible Verse for Today:

We put no stumbling block in anyone's path, so that
our ministry will not be discredited...(2 Cor. 6:3) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

In everything Paul did, he always considered what his actions
communicated about Christ. If you are a believer you are a 
minister for God...

In the course of each day, unbelievers observe you. Don't let 
your careless or undisciplined actions be some person's excuse
for reject Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord Jesus help me to bridal my tongue and actions
so that I would not be a stumbling block to someone. Bless 
and keep my e-mail friends safe and healthy...Amen.

Keep looking up, for daily guidance...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: In everything Paul did, he always considered what his actions communicated about Christ. If you are a believer you are a minister for God. In the course of each day, unbelievers observe you. Don't let your careless or undisciplined actions be some person's excuse for reject Christ.
original_verse_text: We put no stumbling block in anyone's path, so that our ministry will not be discredited.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to live in a manner that honors and glorifies Your name. Help us to be mindful that our lives are a reflection of Your love and grace, a testimony to the transformative power of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Grant us the wisdom and strength to resist the temptations of this world, that we may present our bodies as living sacrifices, holy and acceptable to You. May our thoughts, words, and deeds be a living witness to the truth of Your gospel, drawing others to the hope found in You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In everything Paul did, he always considered what his actions communicated about Christ. If you are a believer, you are a minister for God. In the course of each day, unbelievers observe you. Don't let your careless or undisciplined actions be someone's excuse for rejecting Christ.
subject: Reflect Christ in Your Daily Actions
verse_text: We put no stumbling block in anyone's path, so that our ministry will not be discredited.

original_content:
05/26/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ LUCK: a loser's excuse for a winner's position...(Pro. 13:4)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

In truthful speech and in the power of God; with weapons of
righteousness in the right hand and in the left;

through glory and dishonor, bad report and good report; genuine,
yet regarded as impostors;

known yet regarded as unknown; dying, and yet we live on; beaten,
and yet not killed;

sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; poor, yet making many rich; having
nothing, and yet possessing everything...(2 Cor. 6:7-10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

What a difference it makes to know Jesus! He cares for us in spite 
of what the world thinks. Christians don't have to give in to public
opinion and pressure...

Paul stood faithful to God whether people praised him or slandered
him. He remained joyous and content in the most difficult hardships...

We should not let circumstances or people's expectations control us.
We need to be firm as we stand true to God, and refuse to compromise
His standards for living...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for those times that I have not
remained as faithful as I should. I thank You for Your wondrous 
love in spite of my unfaithfulness. Bless now all my e-mail friends...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is always there for you...
You are in the prayer of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: What a difference it makes to know Jesus! He cares for us in spite of what the world thinks. Christians don't have to give in to public opinion and pressure. Paul stood faithful to God whether people praised him or slandered him. He remained joyous and content in the most difficult hardships. We should not let circumstances or people's expectations control us. We need to be firm as we stand true to God, and refuse to compromise His standards for living.
original_verse_text: In truthful speech and in the power of God; with weapons of righteousness in the right hand and in the left; through glory and dishonor, bad report and good report; genuine, yet regarded as impostors; known yet regarded as unknown; dying, and yet we live on; beaten, and yet not killed; sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; poor, yet making many rich; having nothing, and yet possessing everything.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the example of the Apostle Paul, who remained steadfast in his faith despite facing hardships and persecution. Help us, like him, to stand firm in Your truth and not be swayed by the shifting opinions of the world. Grant us the strength and courage to wield the spiritual armor You have provided, that we may withstand the schemes of the devil and remain faithful to You. May our lives be a testament to Your goodness and grace, even in the midst of life's difficulties. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: What a difference it makes to know Jesus! He cares for us in spite of what the world thinks. Christians don't have to give in to public opinion and pressure. Paul stood faithful to God whether people praised him or slandered him. He remained joyous and content in the most difficult hardships. We should not let circumstances or people's expectations control us. We need to be firm as we stand true to God and refuse to compromise His standards for living.
subject: Unshaken in Christ: Steadfast Amid Pressure
verse_text: In truthful speech and in the power of God; with weapons of righteousness in the right hand and in the left; through glory and dishonor, bad report and good report; genuine, yet regarded as impostors; known yet regarded as unknown; dying, and yet we live on; beaten, and yet not killed; sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; poor, yet making many rich; having nothing, and yet possessing everything.

original_content:
05/27/08 ~~~ Food for thought ~~~ Do the thing you fear and the
death of fear is certain...(Deut. 31:6)

Our Bible Verses For Today:

We have spoken freely to you, Corinthians, and opened wide our hearts to you...

We are not withholding our affection from you, but you are withholding yours
from us...

As a fair exchange ~ I speak as to my children ~ open wide your hearts also...
(2 Cor. 6:11-13) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

"Our hearts are open to you" means that Paul had told the Corinthian
believers his true feelings for them, he had told them clearly how 
much he loved them...

The Corintians were reacting coldly to Paul's words, but Paul explained
that his harsh words came from his love for them. It is easy to react 
against whom God has placed over us in leadership ratter than to accept
their advise as a sign of their love for us...

We need an open ratter than a closed heart toward God's message...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to be more receptive to 
Your leading and guiding. Help me to have a sensitive 
heart and spirit to Your Word I pray in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to show you the way...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: "Our hearts are open to you" means that Paul had told the Corinthian believers his true feelings for them, he had told them clearly how much he loved them. The Corinthians were reacting coldly to Paul's words, but Paul explained that his harsh words came from his love for them. It is easy to react against whom God has placed over us in leadership ratter than to accept their advise as a sign of their love for us. We need an open ratter than a closed heart toward God's message.
original_verse_text: We have spoken freely to you, Corinthians, and opened wide our hearts to you. We are not withholding our affection from you, but you are withholding yours from us. As a fair exchange ~ I speak as to my children ~ open wide your hearts also.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with open and humble hearts, seeking to receive Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to discern Your love and care for us, even when Your words may feel harsh or difficult. Give us the grace to respond with compassion and understanding, rather than with coldness or rejection. May our hearts be receptive to the messages You have for us through those You have placed in authority. We trust in Your perfect plan and purpose for our lives. Amen.
reflection: "Our hearts are open to you" means that Paul had told the Corinthian believers his true feelings for them, he had told them clearly how much he loved them. The Corinthians were reacting coldly to Paul's words, but Paul explained that his harsh words came from his love for them. It is easy to react against whom God has placed over us in leadership rather than to accept their advice as a sign of their love for us. We need an open rather than a closed heart toward God's message.
subject: Open Hearts Receive God's Love
verse_text: We have spoken freely to you, Corinthians, and opened wide our hearts to you. We are not withholding our affection from you, but you are withholding yours from us. As a fair exchange ~ I speak as to my children ~ open wide your hearts also.

original_content:
05/28/08 ~~~food for thought) ~~~Its strange how much you need to know,
before you know how little you know...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness
and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with
darkness?

What harmony is there between Christ and Beliah? What does a believer 
have in common with an unbeliever?

What agreement is there between the temple of God and idols? For we 
are the temple of the living God. As God has said: "I will live with them
and walk among them, and I will be their God, and they will be My people"

"therefore come out of them and be separate, says the Lord. Touch no 
unclean thing, and I will receive you."

"I will be a Father to you, and you will be My sons and daughters," says the 
Lord Almighty... (2 Cor. 6:14-18) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul urges believers to not form partnerships with unbelievers
because this might weaken their Christian commitment, integrity, 
or standards...

It would be a mismatch. Earlier, Paul explained that this did not 
mean isolating oneself from unbelievers (see 1 Cor. 5:9, 10)...

Paul even urged Christians to stay with their unbelieving spouses
(1 Cor. 7:12, 13). Paul wanted Christians to be active in their witness
for Christ to unbelievers but not to lock themselves into personal or
business relationships that could cause them to compromise their
faith...

Believers should do everything in their power to avoid situations that
could force them into dividing their loyalties...

Our Prayer for Today
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to be sensitive to Your Holy
Spirits leading so that I would be aware of opportunities of
witness for You. Help me to remain faithful so as to not 
be drawn into dividing my loyalty to You...Amen.

Keep looking up, that you may remain loyal to Him...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Paul urges believers to not form partnerships with unbelievers because this might weaken their Christian commitment, integrity, or standards. It would be a mismatch. Earlier, Paul explained that this did not mean isolating oneself from unbelievers (see 1 Corinthians 5:9, 10). Paul even urged Christians to stay with their unbelieving spouses (1 Corinthians 7:12, 13). Paul wanted Christians to be active in their witness for Christ to unbelievers but not to lock themselves into personal or business relationships that could cause them to compromise their faith. Believers should do everything in their power to avoid situations that could force them into dividing their loyalties.
original_verse_text: Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness? What harmony is there between Christ and Beliah? What does a believer have in common with an unbeliever? What agreement is there between the temple of God and idols? For we are the temple of the living God. As God has said: "I will live with them and walk among them, and I will be their God, and they will be My people" "therefore come out of them and be separate, says the Lord. Touch no unclean thing, and I will receive you." "I will be a Father to you, and you will be My sons and daughters, " says the Lord Almighty.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the wisdom and guidance found in Your Word. Help us to discern the relationships and partnerships that could lead us astray, drawing us away from the light of Your truth. Grant us the strength to walk in the light, shining Your love and truth to those around us, without compromising our faith. May we be ever vigilant, keeping our eyes fixed on You, the Author and Perfecter of our faith. Amen.
reflection: Paul urges believers to not form partnerships with unbelievers because this might weaken their Christian commitment, integrity, or standards. It would be a mismatch. Earlier, Paul explained that this did not mean isolating oneself from unbelievers (see 1 Corinthians 5:9, 10). Paul even urged Christians to stay with their unbelieving spouses (1 Corinthians 7:12, 13). Paul wanted Christians to be active in their witness for Christ to unbelievers but not to lock themselves into personal or business relationships that could cause them to compromise their faith. Believers should do everything in their power to avoid situations that could force them into dividing their loyalties.
subject: Unequal Partnerships Weaken Christian Commitment
verse_text: Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness? What harmony is there between Christ and Beliah? What does a believer have in common with an unbeliever? What agreement is there between the temple of God and idols? For we are the temple of the living God. As God has said: "I will live with them and walk among them, and I will be their God, and they will be My people" "therefore come out of them and be separate, says the Lord. Touch no unclean thing, and I will receive you." "I will be a Father to you, and you will be My sons and daughters, " says the Lord Almighty.

original_content:
05/29/08 ~~~ food for thought) ~~~ A guilty person runs when no one is chasing him...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Since we have these promises, dear friends, let us purify ourselves
from everything that contaminates body and spirit, perfecting holiness
out of reverence for God...(2 Cor. 7:1) NIV

Our lesson for Today:

Purifying ~~ or cleansing is a twofold action ~~ 
First: it is a turning away from sin ~~
Second: It is a turning to God...

Perfecting Holiness: is the process of becoming more like Christ...
The process will not become complete until we meet Christ face
to face...

But knowing that it is our ultimate destiny should motivate us to 
purify ourselves...

Yes to purify means to keep morally straight, free from the
corruption of sin. God also purifies us, but there is action we
must take to remain morally fit ~~ (see I Tim 5:22; Jm. 4:8; 1 Pet. 1:22)

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, guide and direct me in paths of righteousness
that I might become more Christ-like. Forgive me of my short-comings
so that one day I will meet Christ face-to-face...Amen.

Keep looking up, and receive His purifying power...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Purifying ~~ or cleansing is a twofold action ~~ First: it is a turning away from sin ~~ Second: It is a turning to God. Perfecting Holiness: is the process of becoming more like Christ. The process will not become complete until we meet Christ face to face. But knowing that it is our ultimate destiny should motivate us to purify ourselves. Yes to purify means to keep morally straight, free from the corruption of sin. God also purifies us, but there is action we must take to remain morally fit ~~ (see I Timothy 5:22; James 4:8; 1 Peter 1:22)
original_verse_text: Since we have these promises, dear friends, let us purify ourselves from everything that contaminates body and spirit, perfecting holiness out of reverence for God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we are but sojourners in this world, longing for our eternal home with You. Grant us the wisdom and strength to turn away from the temptations of sin and to walk in the light of Your holiness. Purify our hearts, that we may be made more like Your Son, Jesus Christ. May we ever strive to perfect our holiness, knowing that this is our ultimate destiny. Guide us, Lord, that we may remain morally fit and pleasing in Your sight. Amen.
reflection: Purifying ~~ or cleansing is a twofold action ~~ First: it is a turning away from sin ~~ Second: It is a turning to God. Perfecting Holiness: is the process of becoming more like Christ. The process will not become complete until we meet Christ face to face. But knowing that it is our ultimate destiny should motivate us to purify ourselves. Yes to purify means to keep morally straight, free from the corruption of sin. God also purifies us, but there is action we must take to remain morally fit ~~ (see I Timothy 5:22; James 4:8; 1 Peter 1:22)
subject: Purifying Ourselves: Turning Away from Sin
verse_text: Since we have these promises, dear friends, let us purify ourselves from everything that contaminates body and spirit, perfecting holiness out of reverence for God.

original_content:
05/30/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ There is no mistake so great as 
that of being always right...

Our Bible verses for Today:

Even if I caused you sorrow by my letter, I do not regret it.
Though I did regret it ~ I see that my letter hurt you, but only
for a little while ~

yet now I am happy, not because you were made sorry,but
because your sorrow led you to repentance. For you became
sorrowful as God intended and so were not harmed in any 
way by us...

Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and 
leaves no regret, but worldly sorrow brings death...
(2 Cor. 7:8-10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Sorrow for our sins can result in changed behavior. Many people 
are sorry only for the effects of their sins or for being caught 
("sorrow without repentance")...

Sometime compare Peter"s remorse with Judas's bitterness and
the act of suicide. Both denied Christ. One repented and was 
restored to faith and service: the other took his own life...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for allowing us to come to You
openly seeking Your divine forgiveness for our sins through Jesus 
Christ. Help me become more sensitive to my sinful nature...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to protect You from Satan's cleverness.
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Sorrow for our sins can result in changed behavior. Many people are sorry only for the effects of their sins or for being caught ("sorrow without repentance"). Sometime compare Peter"s remorse with Judas's bitterness and the act of suicide. Both denied Christ. One repented and was restored to faith and service: the other took his own life.
original_verse_text: Even if I caused you sorrow by my letter, I do not regret it. Though I did regret it ~ I see that my letter hurt you, but only for a little while ~ yet now I am happy, not because you were made sorry, but because your sorrow led you to repentance. For you became sorrowful as God intended and so were not harmed in any way by us. Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regret, but worldly sorrow brings death.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts heavy with the weight of our sins. Like Peter, we have fallen short and denied You, yet we are grateful for Your grace and mercy that leads to true repentance. May the sorrow we feel over our transgressions not be a worldly sorrow that leads to despair, but a godly sorrow that produces a change of heart and a renewed commitment to follow You. Cleanse us, Lord, and restore us to Your service, that we may walk in obedience and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Sorrow for our sins can result in changed behavior. Many people are sorry only for the effects of their sins or for being caught ("sorrow without repentance"). Sometime compare Peter"s remorse with Judas's bitterness and the act of suicide. Both denied Christ. One repented and was restored to faith and service: the other took his own life.
subject: Sorrow That Leads to Repentance
verse_text: Even if I caused you sorrow by my letter, I do not regret it. Though I did regret it ~ I see that my letter hurt you, but only for a little while ~ yet now I am happy, not because you were made sorry, but because your sorrow led you to repentance. For you became sorrowful as God intended and so were not harmed in any way by us. Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regret, but worldly sorrow brings death.

original_content:
05/31/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

See what this godly sorrow has produced in you: what earnestness,
what eagerness to clear yourselves, what indignation, what alarm,
what longing, what concern, what readiness to see justice done. 
At every point you have proved yourselves innocent in this matter...
(2 Cor. 7:11) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

It is difficult to be confronted with our sins and even more
difficult to get rid of sin...

Paul praised the Corinthians for clearing up an especially 
troublesome situation (see 2:5-11)...

Do you tend to be defensive when confronted? Don't let
pride keep you from admitting your sin. We need to accept
correction as a tool for our growth, and do all we can to correct
problems that are pointed out to us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me see the sins in my life that
I covet. Help me to confess them and turn from them, that
I might have a closer walk with you...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will point out your sins...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: It is difficult to be confronted with our sins and even more difficult to get rid of sin. Paul praised the Corinthians for clearing up an especially troublesome situation (see 2:5-11). Do you tend to be defensive when confronted? Don't let pride keep you from admitting your sin. We need to accept correction as a tool for our growth, and do all we can to correct problems that are pointed out to us.
original_verse_text: See what this godly sorrow has produced in you: what earnestness, what eagerness to clear yourselves, what indignation, what alarm, what longing, what concern, what readiness to see justice done. At every point you have proved yourselves innocent in this matter.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the weight of our sins and the need to put off our old selves. Help us to be receptive to Your correction, not defensive, that we may grow in righteousness and be renewed in the spirit of our minds. Grant us the courage to confront our shortcomings and the wisdom to make the necessary changes, that we may walk in a manner worthy of Your calling. May our lives be a testament to Your transformative power. Amen.
reflection: It is difficult to be confronted with our sins and even more difficult to get rid of sin. Paul praised the Corinthians for clearing up an especially troublesome situation (see 2:5-11). Do you tend to be defensive when confronted? Don't let pride keep you from admitting your sin. We need to accept correction as a tool for our growth, and do all we can to correct problems that are pointed out to us.
subject: Confront Sin, Embrace Correction
verse_text: See what this godly sorrow has produced in you: what earnestness, what eagerness to clear yourselves, what indignation, what alarm, what longing, what concern, what readiness to see justice done. At every point you have proved yourselves innocent in this matter.
